Metadata: cis, cis- and trans, trans-​Ceratspongamide​, new bioactive cyclic heptapeptides from the Indonesian red alga "Ceratodictyon spongiosum" and symbiotic sponge "Sigmadocia symbiotica."

Chemical investigation of the marine red alga "Ceratodictyon spongiosum" containing the symbiotic sponge "Sigmadocia symbiotica" collected from Biaro Island, Indonesia, yielded two isomers of a new and bioactive thiazole-​containing cyclic heptapeptide, "cis,cis-" and "trans,trans"-​ceratospongamid​e. The peptides are stable conformational isomers of the two proline amide bonds. The "trans,trans" isomer exhibits potent inhibition of sPLA2 expression in a cell-based model for antiinflammatio​n, whereas the "cis,cis" isomer is inactive; "trans,trans"- ceratospongamid​e was also shown to inhibit the expression of a human-sPLA2 promoter-based reporter by 90%.
